Muitas nuvens na Madeira e aguaceiros fracos na Costa Norte e zonas montanhosas
TAP reforça rota da Madeira na ‘festa’ com 500 lugares adicionais por dia
06 Nov 2019, 00:01 by Sandra Ascensão Silva



De acordo com as previsões do Instituto Português do Mar e da atmosfera (IPMA), o clima na Madeira será marcado por períodos de céu muito nublado com aguaceiros fracos, mais prováveis nas vertentes norte e terras altas.
Para a cidade do Funchal, o céu estará ‘pintado’ de cinzento, com muita nebulosidade e vento fraco, inferior a 15 km/h.
De resto, segundo a metrologista do IPMA, Patrícia Marques, esta quarta-feira, 6 de Novembro, terá vento moderado (15 a 30 km/h) de nordeste, soprando moderado a forte (30 a 40 km/h) nas terras altas.
Estado do mar:
Costa Norte: Ondas de nor-noroeste com 3 a 3,5 metros, diminuindo gradualmente para 2 a 3 metros.
Costa Sul: Ondas de sudoeste com 1 a 2 metros, passando gradualmente a ondas de sueste.
Temperatura da água do mar: 22/23ºC
text:
Heavy clouds in Madeira and light showers on the North Coast and mountainous areas
TAP reinforces Madeira's 'party' route with an additional 500 seats per day
06 Nov 2019, 00:01 by Sandra Ascension Silva



According to forecasts from the Portuguese Institute of Sea and Atmosphere (IPMA), the climate in Madeira will be marked by periods of overcast skies with light showers, most likely in the northern slopes and highlands.
For the city of Funchal, the sky will be 'painted' in gray, with a lot of cloudiness and light wind, below 15 km / h.
Moreover, according to IPMA metrologist Patrícia Marques, this Wednesday, November 6, will have moderate wind (15 to 30 km / h) from the northeast, blowing moderate to strong (30 to 40 km / h) in the highlands .
Sea State:
North Coast: North-northwest waves 3 to 3.5 meters, gradually decreasing to 2 to 3 meters.
South Coast: 1 to 2 meter southwest waves, gradually passing to southeast waves.
Sea Water Temperature: 22 / 23ºC
